intro: Stipa exilis, commonly known as slender wheatgrass, is a grass species native to Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. It is a low-growing perennial plant that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Stipa exilis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine and as forage for livestock.
